The name "coltan" is derived from the mineral group columbite-tantalite (coltan = short form). Columbite itself (according to Römpp) is a niobite and tantalite. Coltan is classified as a conflict mineral. Coltan mining in the Congo is mainly concentrated in the Lake Kivu region in the Democratic Republic of the Congo. Internationally known since 2004 due to the battles over exploitation rights between Rwanda and Congo. Coltan is a necessary raw material for the computer and cell phone industry.

This subsequently leads to the fact that cross-coupling is practically the only reaction pathway.

Inorganic chemistry. Ternary carbides and nitrides of the general formula: M(n+1)AXn, where n = 1, 2, 3, i.e. M4AX3 , M3AX2 , M2AX. M is an early transition metal (Ti, V, Ta,...); A is an A-group (usually __ACR0_ and __ACR1_ or groups 13 and 14) element (Al, Ga, Sn,...) and X is either carbon or nitrogen (C,N). MAX phases are nano-layered composite materials. Their hexagonal structure consists of [MX6] octahedra interlaced with A-group element layers. Due to the strong MX bonds, __ACR4_ phases exhibit typical cereals and solids.

Mathematics. "Motivic integration is a notion in algebraic geometry that was introduced by Maxim Kontsevich in 1995 and was developed by Jan Denef and François Loeser. Since its introduction it has proven to be quite useful in various industries of algebraic geometry, most recently birational geometry and singularity theory. Roughly speaking, motivic integration assigns to subsets of the arc space of an algebraic geometry, a volume living in the Grothendieck ring of algebraic variables. The naming 'motivic' mirrors the fact that unlike ordinary integration, for which the values are real numbers, in motivic integration the values are geometric in nature." (Wikipedia: Motive integration)

Stochastics, Operations Research. In non-parametric regression, it is considered that an observation Y at t has the form Y=f(t)+Z, where Z is an error and f is an unknown function. The aim is to estimate the unknown regression function f using observations at t1, ..., tN. While in parametric regression the function f is known down to a finite number of parameters, much less is known about f in non-parametric regression. For example, it is sometimes only assumed that f is Lipschitz-continuous.

Stochastics, Operations Research. Procedure for comparing models based on the maximum likelihood estimation method. Two models are compared in each case: an initial model, which generally contains several model parameters, and a comparison model in which restrictions are imposed on one or more of these parameters. The comparison is always used to check when the unrestricted model is significantly "better" than the restricted model, i.e. has a better fit. If this is not the case, the restricted model is preferred because it is simpler (and yet not worse in terms of explanatory power). (ILMES - Internet-Lexikon der Methoden der empirischen Sozialforschung) (ILMES - Internet-Lexikon der Methoden der Methoden der empirischen Sozialforschung)

The Miles equation is derived using a single degree of freedom system (SDOF), i.e. a single-mass oscillator with light damping, consisting of a mass, a spring and a damer, which is excited by a random oscillation in the range 0 Hz to infinity. The Miles equation is technically applicable for pure SDOF systems. As a rule, the Miles equation is used to calculate the root mean square (r.m.s.) of the vibration response of elastic structures subject to random loads.

Fish fins behave unexpectedly when lateral pressure is applied: For example, if you press slightly against the tail fin of a trout with your finger, it does not bend away in the direction of pressure as expected, but the fin moves against the direction of pressure towards your finger. This effect is known as the fin ray effect. The patented fin ray effect is based on the structure of the individual fin ray. These each consist of two fixed strings that converge at the tip and are primarily functional together there. The two strands form an acute-angled triangle. There are cross strands between the two flexible flanks, which keeps the flank at one another.

Manufacturing technology. Milling is a chip-removing process in which the tool cutting edge performances the main cutting movement. The milling tool rotates and removes a chip with a cutting edge on its face or on its circumferential surface. If the movement of the cutting edge is on a large radius, this is referred to as flycutting. If the flycutting tool is mounted radially, linear structures, e.g. diffraction gratings, can be produced easily. If the flycutting tool is positioned on the end face, very large surfaces with particularly low roughness (Ra = 2 to 10 nm) can be produced, e.g. mirrors.
